Posts.Content: I really struggle with the asking for help thing.  Always feel like I'm being a nuisance. Thanks. I've just got to hold my hand up and shout. X
Posts.Title: First chemo was on 17th August

Posts.Content: Thanks for that. I hate letting work down. But I just seem to be letting everyone down. It's all such an effort. So hard on my youngest daughter who is nearly 10 and my eldest daughter who has recently had a baby. Xx
Posts.Title: First chemo was on 17th August

Posts.Content: Hi all. I need help. I hate having to ask. I've had my first chemo and was determined to remain positive. All my positiveness has gone and I don't want to go back for any more treatment.  The nurses said the first three weren't too bad, that it was the last 3 that were worse. I hate it. I was back at work on the Friday as I felt OK but it's just been a roller coaster since. I was bad on sunday, managed work on monday and tuesday and half day wednesday. My throat is awful - can't swallow very much, my mouth isn't much better and I feel wrecked. I just keep crying. Feel so pathetic!
Posts.Title: First chemo was on 17th August

Posts.Content: Thank you. That made me laff. I know, I know.  Xx
Posts.Title: First chemo was on 17th August

Posts.Content: Hi jwoowoo I had an LD flap and reconstruction on 15 June this year - just over 6 weeks ago.  You sound like me. I thought i'd be up and running and recovering well - it was such a shock. The pain was nothing I could ever have imagined. I still find it uncomfortable and have only started to sleep on that side. I find my arm quite painful and cannot straighten it without a shooting pain. And my back is still sore. It's hard work. Quite normal I've been told. Get tired of everyone saying how well I look! It's 'good' (I know that's  not the right word) to know there is someone else going through the same. JackiRuss
Posts.Title: Pain and discomfort following a mastectomy and LD flap reconstruc...

Posts.Content: Hiya. I'm 8 weeks post op. I went back to work last week. (I've still got issues with mysurgery - discomfort in my back and under my arm. ) But  It was the best thing I did. It took my mind off feeling sorry for myself and focused on something else. I'm always doing something so it worked for me. I started driving last week too. Still have a few aches but it's much better. Everyone is different though.
Posts.Title: Pain and discomfort following a mastectomy and LD flap reconstruc...

Posts.Content: I had mine fitted 10 days ago. It did settle down quite quickly.
